snippet: Stations owned and operated by CBS in 14 markets returned to Dish’s service after a brief absence when the two companies ended a six-month contract fight.
abstract: CBS programming is restored for Dish Network subscribers after broadcaster and satellite television provider resolve a six-month contract dispute.
lead_paragraph: Stations owned and operated by CBS in 14 markets returned to Dish’s service after a brief absence when the two companies ended a six-month contract fight.

headline.main: CBS and Dish End Dispute, Resolving a 12-Hour Blackout
headline.print_headline: CBS and Dish End Dispute, Resolving a 12-Hour Blackout
